author: duftler
msg: The Serializer for String and the primitives will now run all content
through Utils.cleanString(String), instead of first checking to make
sure that the javaType is java.lang.String.

author: duftler
msg: The serializer for java.lang.String will now escape the following
characters: & " ' < >
The Utils.cleanString(String) method was already there, it just
wasn't being called by this serializer.

author: sanjiva
msg: Changed to use \r\n instead of println for line endings in HTTP. This
is what it should've been! Thanks to Kevin Mitchell for the work.
Obtained from:
Submitted by:	Kevin J. Mitchell (kevin.mitchell@xmls.com)
Reviewed by:	Sanjiva Weerawarana (sanjiva@watson.ibm.com)

author: sanjiva
msg: Matt fixed the byte[] encoding to go into a SOAPEnc:binary type
(base64 encoded binary value) instead of the dumb way it was doing
it earlier. Also, SOAPEnc:binary values now decode into byte[].
Matt did all the work; his cvs stuff aint working yet.
Note that this commit forces the use of Xerces 1.1.2 because
the Base64 encoder utility is only in that and not in any previous
version of Xerces.
Submitted by: Matthew Duftler
Reviewed by: Matthew Duftler

author: gdaniels
msg: Add support for serializing Vectors/Enumerations via VectorSerializer.
